result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon T. Heather was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:  

Cooperate with and obtain all assessments/follow up treatment as required by agent.

Pay court costs and costs of supervision.

Do not possess/consume any controlled substances or be in any location where controlled substances are present (only exception is prescription drugs prescribed to def). 

Credit in the event of revocation:  1 day. 

DNA sample to be provided at the RCSD before signing up for probation. 

Court will allow expungement per 973.015 following def's successful completion of probation.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon T. Heather

records.addlTxt: Correspondence between COC and local P/P office re the status of court costs. Per the local office, Def is currently in absconder status.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Adams County Probation and Court Services Department copies of prior arrests or convictions; Mailed copies of Criminal Complaint and JOC 04-17-17
Petition and Order Permitting Attorney to Withdraw
Statement of Negotiated Plea

Defendant Brandon T. Heather in court with attorney Gregg Earl Waterman. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Amended information filed.  Formal reading waived.  Information contains 4 misdemeanor counts of THC and 1 misdemeanor paraphernalia count.  Court states the max. penalties; notes error in the plea questionnaire.  Def states he understands the possible max. punishment.  Def pleads    to counts 1-5 of the information.  Counsel's recommendation is for 3 years probation with conditions to include compliance with all required assts/treatments as request of agent and payment of costs.  Def pleads guilty to the five counts contained in the information.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty. Counsel address the Court re joint recommendation.  DA asks for expungement upon successful completion of probation by the def.  

Court's sentence:  withheld for 3 years probation.  Conditions:  Must cooperate with and obtain all assts/follow up treatment as required by agent; pay court costs; do not possess/consume any controlled substances or be in any location where controlled substances present (only exception is prescription drugs prescribed to def).  Credit in the event of revocation:  1 day.  DNA sample to be provided at the RCSD before signing up for probation.  Court will allow expungement per 973.015 following def's successful completion of probation.
Status conference at 11-06-2015 11:30 am
From Atty. Waterman re Nov. 6th - requests status held in morning; Judge C's office sets 11:30
Status conference at 11-06-2015 01:15 pm
from Atty. W - not available Oct. 7th
Status conference at 10-07-2015 02:30 pm

9:45 a.m. Defendant Brandon T. Heather and Attorney Gregg Earl Waterman not in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court questions why def and counsel are not here.  DA's office nor clerk's office have received correspondence.  DA asks for warrant that is stayed for a short period of time, until next date Court is here, and also set a telephone status to require Atty. W to explain his lack of appearance.  Court authorizes bench warrant for def, however, that is stayed until a date/time to be set with the Court's JA at which time the def and Atty. W must be present at the Richland County Courthouse for a phone call to the Court's office in Crawford.
Status conference at 09-25-2015 09:00 am
email from JA re scheduling.

1:00 p.m.  The status hearing scheduled for 10:30 today in this case will be rescheduled to another date that Judge C will again be in Richland County.  The case was not heard today as Atty. Waterman was delayed and not present at case start time.  Due to other matters on the calendar this date, the Court did not have time to take the matter up out-of-order.
Atty W. requested rescheduling from 9:00 to 10:30 on 08/25/2015. No objection from DA.
Status conference at 08-25-2015 09:00 am
email from JA to clerk re. scheduling
approved 6-24-15

Defendant Brandon T. Heather in court with attorney Gregg Earl Waterman. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for the State.  Forehand calls State's witness, Deputy D Kanable.  DK sworn by the clerk and questioned on direct and cross.  Court orders bindover and sets arraignment for June 24th at 11.  Arraignment scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Brandon T. Heather in court with attorney Gregg Earl Waterman. Prosecuting Atty Timothy C. Baxter appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Formal reading waived.  Rights stated.  Prelim requested and set.  June 19 at 3 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance at 06-03-2015 01:30 pm

1:59 p.m.  Defendant Brandon T. Heather in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Gregg Earl Waterman appeared by phone means for Defendant Brandon T. Heather.  Def states that his phone number changed and he today attempted to call counsel with that new number.  Court quashes the warrant that was ordered earlier today on def's non-appearance.  Adj. initial further adjourned to June 3rd at 1:30.  Def is directed to complete change of address form to ensure Court has his correct information.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

9:35 a.m.  Defendant Brandon T. Heather not in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Gregg Earl Waterman in court for Defendant Brandon T. Heather.  Atty. Waterman states that he has no information about def's whereabouts.  DA requests warrant.  Court so orders.
Adjourned initial appearance at 05-20-2015 09:00 am

Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brandon T. Heather in court. Atty. L McDougal present but states she cannot represent.  Def does qualify for SPD.  Atty. M requests setover of the initial so that counsel can be appointed.  Charges stated.  Initial adj. to May 20 at 9.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.
